content:
Yash RE said:

I noticed another change that I don't think has been discussed, the prototype reorders the list in the top left. It goes
from: all, private, mentions, starred, drafts, recent topics
to: all, recent topics, mentions, starred, drafts, private

which is an interesting change... I wonder if we'd like: recent topics, mentions, starred, drafts, private, all. (ie putting recent topics at the top since it's the default view).

I don't think anyone replied to this, or did I miss something?
You right, I should make them as much in current version

Ok, so the current order is image.png
And we can have the same in the new design.

Do we want to reorder things here? I thought to have expandable Private messages down and bringing up the default narrower. image.png
Now I learned that default is configurable. But still I would prefer to have cumulative number be on top.
Yeah, I think the cumulative number being on top feels important from a hierarchy standpoint.

@Vlad Korobov the current plan for Private Messages is to move it below that top area, and have it work conceptually like the topics within a stream. (Where we'd display the most recent 5-8 conversations, prioritizing those with unreads, and then you could click a "more topics" like button to expand it to take over the whole sidebar).
Nobody have started implementation work on such a migration, and I am not sure that this would work out as nicely as we hope it will.

But I think it's possible that first doing a change that swaps Recent Topics and Private Messages would be helpful, if we think we want Recent Topics to be second and Drafts last after doing that migration on Private messages, which seems plausible.
I support promoting Recent Topics.
So will it be like an always opened stream or Private messages would be as a single line until activated?

I want us to experiment with an always-opened section for private messages; I think they are deemphasized too much in the current single line approach. But as Tim said, there's definitely a risk that we might not like it when we try it.
Can I ask to have ability to collapse them? Sometimes I don't want people to see the list of my recent Private conversations while I'm sharing the screen of Zulip?
I guess I would like to have an ability to collapse the whole Section, which could be Streams, Users, Private messages?
Collapsible sections seem reasonable to me.
Filed #20869 for the Recent topics <-> Private messages ordering swap.
I also filed #20870 for the open PMs section idea.
How are folks feeling about the new location for "Private messages"?

I kinda feel like it's not an improvement in isolation in terms of my own experience -- in part because of the choppy nature of the unread counts here:

image.png
So my temptation would be to abandon this change until we can do the redesign of the "Private messages" that we've been hoping to do.
I think it's ok to not release it until the Private messages is a separate thing. But I wouldn't bother to roll it back. There is nothing bad about this change.
It felt fine to me.
I don't have strong feelings on it. I do sometimes look for PMs or Recent topics in the wrong place; I'm pretty sure it's habit.
I like the change. Having them under drafts just feels right to me.
@Tim Abbott If you are OK with it, I think we can merge #20877 into main.

I'm fine with merging the peace that is moving "Recent topics" to the top; I don't want to move "Private messages" potentially a couple weeks before removing it in favor of a new component -- that'd result in extra unnecessary UX churn for users.
(I at least personally had an initial "this isn't where I expect it" reaction to "Private messages" moving on me when first deployed, which at least suggests some UX churn cost to users).
Well, the new "Private messages" component will be below that whole section, but you're probably right that only moving it down when we have the new component ready will be nicer.
